comments.text: Super nice spot to Ljubljana
One guy took us the entire way to nürenberg, a lot of cars stopped for us immediately for shorter distances inside slovenia. Extremely good spoz
This spot is good to get to Ljubljana or Villach or even further north. There were not a lot of people heading north because of the off season but we got a one ride to Salzburg. We were 2 men.
great place to catch a car to Ljubljana (group of girls)
Waited 30 minutes and had a direct ride to Salzburg (solo male backpacker)
There Is a second lane where you can wait. Ideal for direction rijeka
Great spot! We had just pulled out the sign and a Bosnian driver had stopped and take us to Rijeka.
waited on sunday morning about 15min with sign to rijeka and a german stopped and Offered ride. they were going further in croatia so I asked if they can drop me near krk island
Empty lane on the bridge other the expressway. All cars that go south pass you. Waited 10 mins with a sign "south"
Great. Sign Reka (Slo for Rijeka)
Cars driving slowly, enough place to stop safely, we got caught  easily to go to Ljubljana with a panel.
Got a ride from Slavoj Žižek lookalike! Same accent and biased opinion! :)
guys, I seriously cannot imagine standing there, there is not enough place for a car to SAFELY stop. I went to VinaKopper and it took about 2.5 hour to get a lift.
easy to get a ride. a guy was already waiting there but fortunately our driver could take 2 of us to Ljubljana.
When I arrived there, there was already someone else, but I waited like 5 min and he was gone, it was also really easy for me !
Wonderful spot for going towards kočevje. Space to stop and easy to see. People slow down for the traffic light. Got a ride to the croatian border in 15 min.
Lots of traffic going direction Kočevje. Easy to stop at the bus stop or a bit further on. Use a sign.
got a ride to kočevje in a minute at 9.30 am ^^

i tried it two times when going to kočevje and it turned out to be the spot to go to. it's easily accessible from ljubljana with buses number 3b and 3g. the ticket costs the same as if going round the city
there is a bus stop with good visiblity and people go slowly due to the speed limit. there is a lot of traffic going towards kočevje and croatian border :).

Parking next to cementery - towards Trenta
A lot of turists (especially German and Austrian) take this road so it's easy to catch somebody. They're willing to take you at least for few kilometers.
Less than a minute on traffic lights and we got a lift, but you could hike there too
started walking from the roundabout where we were dropped of, after 3min a car with tourists from russia took us to the lake, no real room to stop, but traffic isn't very fast yet.
5 mins to Bled, 2 boys, September mid-day, mid-week. Cars go slow so they can stop even is there's not vey much place.
Good spot to go to Ljubljana
big trucks can't stop here and i bet small can't either.
I was lucky to get a local going to the Bohinj lake right away.. just a thumb

11 min to Ukanc, two boys, late afternoon, September, mid-week. Almost all cars go to the shores of Bohinj Lake. The cars go slow and tehre is a curve, but there will see you and stop if they want. There is also a spot 100m to the east, nearby the bakery.
We had a lift to Hungary to Balaton, we asked 3 cars and  one of these took us
on our way to piran, got dropped here, Koper/ the slov. coast is not easy from here cuz a lot are going to italy or croatia, but it worked for us

Good spot to hitch-hike to Ljubljana.A lot of cars and trucks stop by.You can get here if you go till the end of Ljubljanska cesta ( near are military barracks) then go over railway and under the highway and turn left.

Travelling from Ljubljana to Beograd with a friend, we wanted a ride to Zagreb to further hitch from there but actually ended up getting a ride all the way to Beograd! This gas station wasn’t too busy (3pm) but all the people were friendly and we quickly got the ride from 2 Italian guys after asking around for about 10 minutes
On the way to Belgrade, got a ride to Novska (100 km east of Zagreb) after some 20 minutes, allowing me to avoid the Zagreb ring road.
Brand new petrol station, the place to get out if your ride is going to Novo Mesto and you want to continue on towards Croatia.
The spot is great we usually go to the gasolin station but here is waste of time. Go to this spot

This spot is almost perfect. The cars drive slow, can see you quite clearly, they have plenty of space to stop, there isn't too much traffic and the place is right next to two supermarkets and a gas station.
Good spot to got to bled
super spot to catch a car to Bled
Perfekt spot to the lake

Very nice spot..
 I think better than the one below. Many local cars but all going to the Bohinj valley
Actually a very good spot due to the bus stop and the traffic light. We waited quite long maybe because of the rain or we just got a bit unlucky
Were standing on previous stop, but this one has shadow and traffic lights, got a lift almost to Bled in 5 min
Perfect place to hitchhike if you want to go to Ljubljana. I had a sign and I waited only 3 minutes for someone took us to LJ. There is a bus station so it is easy for the car to stop.
I waited before the bus station and got a ride after 10 minutes very easy no need to pay for bus. Super easy to hitchhike in slowenia
There is a petrol station where you can hitchhike right before the highway, just make sure to have a sign or they won't easily stop.
After 2 minutes of waiting with a sign “Vransko” somebody stopped and drove me to Maribor.

Sign "A2 BLED"
Planned to also ask the people at the gas station but it was not necessary for picked up instantaneously
We got a direct ride to the campsite in Kamnik
I was stopping there with sign Ljubljana. young guy took me to a gas station on the highway from where I got a ride in 20min

I was stopping with sing Koper and aster a minute or two an o older guy pulled over at the gas station and took me to Izolo (city right next to Koper) 

Also during the time I standed there a guy on bike recommended to try the spot next to highway entry few km ahead that people usually hitchhike there.
Got a ride to split in pretty much no time, even though there's not room for cars to stop
Good spot, at least on the holiday season. We were 2 guys. Really nice view and nature around.

I got dropped off by a driver at this petrol station/rest stop. Used the free toilets and filled my water bottles. Headed to the entrance to the motorway, where I waited for 10 minutes and a kind family headed to Ljubljana, picked me up.  There was a decent flow of cars and trucks, it was about 5pm at the time. If you wait with a sign with your destination or just your thumb you should have good luck with hitching from this spot no problems, highly recommended. Also accessible by walking, so it'
We waited in the bus station and someone took us to the entrance of Novo Mesto, really easy to hitchhike in Slovenia. People offer us coffee and drinks in the supermarket :)

Got dropped of here by a lady, crazy spot, no gas station is sight, just highway, quite dangerous because cars go fast, next to no place for cars to stop. I was just arriving and contemplating how I was more likely to die here than to get a ride out of here when suddenly a very nice Crostian guy stopped who saw my sign, he brought me all the way to my final destinastion! (To Triest)
Nice spot, cars have to stop here because of the stop sign. In 7 minutes I refused one ride to lake Bled and then stepped in with a woman in a pink car who brought me to a spot next to the highway
I didn’t have the time to put my bag down that a car already stopped and take me to Ptuj
Excellent ride to Ljubljana
1st person i asked tooked me. unfortunately he didnt wanted to make a roadtrip with me to albania.
i waited just after the border cars were slow. Two crazy croatians with beer picked me up and bought me mcces can recommend
The first guy such a G tooked me in his car to postojna unfortunately he didnt wanted to change his plans and take all the way to albania
We had best luck! We sat down with a cold drink and put our sign with Croatia on the table. He asked us if we needed to go to Croatia. We said yes and hopped in!
We waited 3 minutes and a woman stopped.
First car stopped.
Got woven over to the patrol station and got a ride directly to the border.
Right at the barrier, where the cars have to stop.
got a ride to Cividale really quickly. You can also ask people leaving the parking spot nearby.
took us 10 min to get a ride to Cividale without a sign
good spot to catch a car to Ljubljana (two girls)
Instant pickup in direction to Slovenia. There is plenty of space to stop and a nice tree to get shadow

2 people, a boy and a girl.
This is definitely a better way how to get to maribor from this area, because many slovenians take the old road instead of the highway. We got picked up by the first car, but maybe we were just lucky. To get there you just have to walk a little bit down from the gas station, like 5 minutes. 
Sign to MA (Maribor).
I tried luck at nearby gas station but no luck. Caught a ride to Graz in 5 minutes when walked to an old Slovenian border control.
Bus stop. Carson go slow from the roundabout. Got ride in less than a minute
Great spot to get out of the city. South direction
Great spot to get in and out of Bled. We got a direct ride to Ljubljana in less than 10 min
get lift to Poland ;DD

Good spot to hitchhike to Predjama Castle. Recommend walking past the caves so you won't get cars going there. Took a bus to Postojna from Ljubljana, they go pretty often.
 
Enough space for cars to stop on the bike lane. A lot of people don't go to the castle though but instead continue forward at the cafe Prepih, where it's a 4km walk to the castle or you could try getting another ride.
Very quickly got a ride across Croatian border
Quite busy station, serbian truck driver took me to the austrian border after 10min waiting.
Good spot, there just wasn't many cars on a random Tuesday at 3 pm. Still got a truck driver to the border (two people, he didn't want to cross it with illegal passenger).
It's me again :). We are a couple and it was in March, so no tourists, but we asked a hungarian truckdriver for a ride and he took us to the lake Balaton.
5 minutes and I went to Maribor! Great place to hitchhike, wish to find more like this one.
We get a hike from here to our hometown Szeged, Hungary (555 km from here). But there were a lot of romanian, polish cars, and a lot of people from Austria as well. This is a hitchhiking paradise :).
waited for quite a while, i was heading to Piran. found a ride to Portoroz
If you're stuck, you can join the city easily by foot. Not many cars stopping. We went to the city to continue to Piran.
We wanted to go to Rovinj, this was after the exit. Luckely someone brought us to the good road a bit back.
life is short - take the scenic route :) - this will take you along the shore to the beautiful city of Piran, well worth seeing!
OMV Gas Station near the Train Station in Koper, great for the direction Izola, Piran or Lucija.
There is a bus stop, plenty cars and room to stop
bus stop towards Croatia. found a car to Pula eventually. use a sign HR
A bit complicated to reach the spot by  foot. Cars going a bit fast but we finally found a driver after 30 min to go to Koper with a panel.
Piran - Croatia: Good spot for finding a ride into Croatia at the bus stop. Waited 10 minutes with a sign. Got picked up by a German family in a van turned RV.
bus stop direction bled
I left in the morning when campers are checking out at 9am and got picked up after 2 cars in 5 minutes
almost no traffic, but everybody stops at least to the next village
Maybe there is not so much traffic, but it’s almost perfect spot to Lublana. Although food in gas station is very expensive.
awesome place fro Ljubljana or Trieste/Croatia!
got a ride to ljubljana on the easter monday at 22.15 as soon as i arrived there =)
a larger rest area where a lot of truckers fill up.
Very good Spot. We headed Nord and got a ride to Villach

Very hot, a lot of traffic passes by, but hesitant to take 
Saved by 2 German students from a uni group coming to LJ
perfect spot to go to Ljubljana
Great spot
Very easy. We were on the grass just before the gaz station and 2 cars stop in 5 minutes

We stood here without a sign and got picked immediately towards Trieste. There is a lot of traffic and people notice you. The lady who took us told that in the past this spot was very known for hitchhiking.
The spot seems good but it wasn’t that good. We (3 guys) waited 1:30h and finally got picked up to Postojna.

Even though this spot was very praised, and there's nice markings by fellow hitchhikers on a traffic sign, I had to wait 1,5 h to get a ride towards Trieste. Even got middle-finger'd once. Gave up with using a sign in half an hour. After 1h 15min the first car stopped for me, but was going to Novo mesto. A while after that, a super nice and helpful Slovenian mother picked me eventually up and took me to the halfway and donated me some mixed nuts and drove home. And then she came back to me in or
tried to get to Trieste with no luck for an hour. eventually a car took me straight to Koper after i made a sign KP

we waited for like 2 hours and gave up. It's not a good point to go to Croatia . We asked some poeple to breng us to the gasstation en there we had a lift in 5 minutes. So don't be afraid to asked at the Lidle parking, a little lift to the gasstation.
Seems like people are not happy to stop at the border for some reason. After 50min one italian guy stopped and he said that it's not good spot to hitchhike and he took me to station on the highway
I used this spot in 2016, pretty great spot

Italian-slovenian border. Directly after the crossing point there is a quite long turnoff where you can safely stand. There is no motorway here (in case police stop you), speed limit is 50 kph and there are a lot of cars.
Good petrol station, nice family took us to Salzburg
We were a couple, we had a sign with « Austria », we waited 10 minutes before a car going to Munchen took us, Salzbourg is on the way
Cars go quite fast but spot you from afar and have enough space to slow down; its right next to a bus station :)
super spot to catch a car to ljubljana
Much local traffic but it is a great spot. 3 cars stopped before we (2 people) catched a ride straight to Ljublajana
Accepted a ride to the next gas station after two hours on a sunday morning, next time I'll stay here.
Supercool spot to hitchhike. We were just writing sign to Croatia, when a group of young people offered us a ride.

2 people, a boy and a girl. This is the perfect spot, because people from all directions of the crossroad are going down south. We got picked up by an amazing young girl who took us to celje, which is the halfway to Maribor. She also recommended us a good spot in Celje. Sign to LJ/CE.
On Sunday morning, we were two and waited only 15 minutes to get a ride direction Zagreb. Good spot even the cars drive fast.
Good spot, place for cars to stop, got a ride to Koper!
We stood for 3 minutes next to the zebra crossing and got a ride to Ljubljana. Good spot.
excelent spot to get out of maribor, cars go slow after the intersection and we got a ride to celje, use a sign LJ to go in that direction
BIg sign Ljublana on sunday at 7am, got a ride in 5min. I also dumped dive the decathlon close by and found some clothes, a dart target and swimming goggles lol
I was waiting the with sign LJ less than 1 minute. It' s really perfect spot for direction Ljubjana.
Take any ride to the middle of the valley. One guy drove me for 10min and that eliminates 70% of the drivers. Than i got a ride to Maribor in 2 minutes.

Bus station - safe and sound. The road goes to Tuhinjska dolina(valley) and onwards to Celje.
My friend uses it daily to get to the valey home. The traffic is good.
Waited 10 min for a ride to ljubljana with an LJ sign on a saturday at 8am. There is a good space for people to stop at the bus stop.

To go to LJ this is a very good spot as there is a bus station here where cars can easily stop. Every time I hitchhike towards East (LJ, CE, MB) I do it from this place and so far the average waiting time is about 5-7 minutes, and based on my experience this qualifies as a very good rating.
Drinking water and bathrooms (90 min wait). It seems most people go back to Koper in the next exit. But we were losing hope, a slovenian olimpic sailor took us to Piran.

Probably best to walk towards this spot. You know you're there if you are standing on a bus stop and you can see a yellow sign that says 'Ljubljana-left', 'Olmo-straight', 'some street-right'. If you want to get to Trieste it's better to have a sign because most of the cars are going towards Ljubljana. You can also ask for a ride to the first or second petrol station on the highway and ask drivers who stop there to give you a lift (it worked for us once, when it was really late). This spot is we
There is a shadow under the bridge for sunny days. An old french couple took 2 male hikers to Trieste

Almost every car goes to Italy. A czech couple gave us a lift to Trieste where we wanted to go. After you went down of the motorway, there is a table that shows: at right is Trieste. From that table just walk 5 minutes, and after you went under the motorway, just some steps, and there is a place where the cars can stop.
hitchhiking alone, male, early 30s, waiting with sign and asking people directly. the rest area was almost deserted tho

If you just approach people at this stop there is a really high chance of being picked up to head north. Basically everyone there (including loads of amazing truckers) who is stopping there will be heading north, at least to Austria. We waited for a bit but as soon  as we tried approaching the truckers we got a lift in 2 minutes
Got a ride to Brixen, Italy via Ausria in a couple of minutes. Two Bosnian who went to Switzerland.
Weekday, end of august, 8am. Not very crowded, lots of cars were full, found a lift to Munich in 30min.
Seems worse/less crowded than the one before near Kranj. Still I got a ride in 10min to Stuttgart, but got lucky with that!

Very easy to get to with 1€ City Bikes. We initially just used hand signal but then we eventually got a ride with Postojna sign at the bus stop. decent amount of trafic a lot of supportive waves and beeps :).

Two cars stopped. The first one very nice but going the wrong way. The second one was a lovely family used to hitchhiking and hosting people on couch surfing. They invited me to stay and join them at a 2cv car festival that was visiting town. Unfortunately, I had to decline because they lived so close to where I was leaving but generally a good spot. 

Traffic is coming from multiple directions towards the highway and there's lots of space for them to stop at the bus stop.
go further on the on ramp ;)
Bus stop, just after the traffic lights. Lots of traffic.
bus stop direction bled
Asked people in the parking lot and after 5 minutes I got a ride, very easy
Spot to go to Bled, all the cars leaving the different parkings of Bohinj and going to Bled have to pass there.
bus stop direction Ljubljana.
2 people, a boy and a girl. This is the best spot to LJ. We got picked up by the first car that saw us. There is a bus stop where the cars can stop comfortably. Sign for LJ.

Two days, one mission! Hitchhike to Ljubljana. The first night I failed missarebly, it was dark and cold. 

The next day I returned with a thought that I have to beat this city. I was sucsesfull in 10 min.

It is the best place to hitchhike to Lj or Mb. the bus station is riht infront of the higway entrance.
maybe best spot to hitch out of celje to ljubljana or to maribor. waited 1h10min with 4 hitchhikers for a ride to maribor

There is a construction going on here , and there is no petrol station or any restaurant here at the moment- only truck drivers coming here to rest or some cars rarely too- 

I had to go and check an other place. Good luckk
Good spot to get out of Ljubljana; ride to Novo Mesto within 20 minutes or so.

Beginning of September
Good spot. Drivers are going to local cities or Zagreb.
Look for NM license plate or croatian.
Good spot for Zagreb, I used it successfully after taking the bus out of town and walking across the golf course. [Blog Post about getting there](http://www.hobospirit.com/slovenia/)
Good spot becouse it is a big gas station and many cars stop by.People here are going to east of slovenia ( Celje, Maribor..) or croatia (zagreb).Super spot to hitch-hike.
Loads of German cars going home, you just need to find the one with some space to spare.
Very unlucky place, not much traffic compared to many other rest areas. Many tourists with full cars going back to Germany. Took over 4,5h to get a car to Munich.

Needed 15min to get a ride to munich. We asked the people at the gas station. A lot of german, austrian and dutch tourists stop here before the go to Austria. We were standing there at 12pm and the german summer holidays were over since 3 days but a lot of people were still there.
waited two hours for a ride to Austria
Good place to go Jesenice.
Directly to Budapest with possibilty directly to  Wrocław
got a ride to ljubljana city center in 5 minutes.

i think this should be a great spot towards slovenia, even back to italy. but probably not around 10pm but even though we got a ride to ljubljana! thax to that very nice croatian couple. (we could go even to zagreb!)
good spot; got a ride directly to Zagreb!
Got a ride all the way to Ljubljana by the 3th Person I saked.
The place is currently under contruction but it works. If you are heading to Austria I recomend to take only cars going to highway. We made this mistake and it was pain to get back
most of cars are going to Kranj. polish couple took me to Lake Bohinj after declining 4 cars. had a sign BLED
Good spot to get a ride to Bled or further, there was a little bit of construction so we were not too visible but the cars can stop easy. We were 2 men.
Very good spot going out of the city.. direction to Bled. Two of us waited.. from the same spot are also going Arriva buses right to Bled, in case you can't stop anyone
2 people, ~21:00, was dark already, but standing near the crossing so cars can stop at the bus station was good.
Many traffic going south, even at night we got ride to Zagreb
We were 2 guys, got a hitch to Ljubljana. Very nice view here.
Most of the cars are tourist without any room, and local cars didnt even look. Seems like a good place but i guess you have to be lucky.
Many people going to Zagrzeb and Lubljana, it’s easy to hitchhike there!

Not the fastest hitchhiking time in my case, but the spot does live up to the criteria of a good spot. Cars not going too fast, a little spot to pullover, and even (depending on the time of the day) opportunity to stand in the shadow of the road sign when the sun is burning

Busy junction, but not so safe for cars to stop. After 1 hour, a car stopped and took me to Ljubljana.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Koper
Ride stright to Lublana but if you want go futher It could be possible a lot of CZ, PL and H plates so its a good spot to avoid LJ
After two hours waiting (from 4 pm untill 6 pm) for a car to go to Bled, we decided to go into Ljubljana and take the train.

We (2 boys) spent 1h30min looking for someone going towards Maribor. We gave up and accepted an offer to Ljubljana. There was also a car which would take us in direction Zagreb. It was September morning, Saturday (which I think was quite essential for our failure), raining.
This petrol station is great to change drivers if You want to head towards Kranj. I hitchhiked from here to Kranj at the end of September - I got a ride in about 15 minutes.
Normal gas station, they have good pastry sortiment, a bit too expensive though.
found a car to postoljna from here.
When going south, a perfect gas station to ljubljana of course, but also to koper/trieste. It might works well to go to croatia, even if cars are oftenly full during holidays.
Most traffic goes to Lublana. I had a sign with Zagreb on, but it can be really difficult to get someone further than LJ.

a lot of cars use this entrance of the highway. some  because of the gas station, but a lot just speed up for the motorway. but they've got plenty of times to see you and slow down. it was a rainy day, saturday afternoon but we get a ride to LJ in 10 minutes.
Good spot just not too many cars but if so, they are quite fast, but all are heading towards Austria.. also possible to ask around at the pump

The spot is about 100 m from the petrol station. There is place for the cars to stop. The road is straight, but the cars are going quite fast. There is no many cars passing by. If somebody pick you up, it's more than possible that they will take you at least to Klagenfurt in Austria.
Wanted to go to Zagreb, was probably a bad location for this, as people were slowing down to see if they go the same direction, but after an hour I changed my spot for a better one
A bus station (Safe and sound). I use it to go to Kamnik. But it is possible to go to Novo mesto or Maribor also - but I never tried it.
Great spot, we have the sign and got the ride all the way to Maribor. There is good place to stop and also shopping center is near.
There is a street going to the right where cars can stop. For direction Maribor it's good as everyone is on the right hand lane already. Need a sign!

Lots of traffic due to a 2cv citroen car festival. It meant a lot of the traffic was local but there were also cars going further. I was picked up by a smart car. My first time in a smart car - they're bigger than you think! 

Driver took me past where he was going and dropped me at the border crossing for Croatia.
mid spot drivers not stoping, got taken by a nice egg delivery woman after asking her on the parking spot, bridge up north probably is better but there was a guy with rifle so i went away
Typical highway station and rest place. Mostly trucks taking obligatory breaks. With some patience you can easily get at least to Ljubljana, with some Celje/Maribor or even Austria or Hungary
Tons of traffic in the right direction towards pula. Stand in front of the bus stop so drivers can pull in. I’m assuming it would be good for trieste as well
Got a ride to ilirska bistrica. everyone was nice and waved at us.
Cars going in to the E61 are slowing down thanks to the turn. It is not the most comfortable place to stop for a car but it worked for us regardless.

We were trying to get a lift to Ljubljana in the evening. Many cars but most of them are fully packed for holidays, or did not stop. We slept in the fields next to the station and tried again next morning. After one hour we got a lift towards Ljubljana. Asking people at the Gas station or the Restaurant might be more succesful. Still it is a good spot I think.
Great trafic and plenty of space to stop, but cars were reluctant to pick us up as it was getting slowly dark

Theoretically a perfect place to hitchhike. Most people are going in the right direction, the cars are moving slowly and there's lots of places to stop. Still, it didn't seem like anyone was going to stop for me. 

In the end, I smiled and waved at someone and they stopped. They said they never took hitchhikers before. 

There are two checkpoints and I recommend trying both. I had luck when I moved from the croatian side to the slovenian side. 

The driver took me to the bridge near Kirk a
Very good
Was left here by my previous ride. Good to get ride into ljubljana
horrible spot but nice daydrinkin ppl. We stiped to eat gullash and drank beer before we continued but nice hike although spot is mid
Tuesday at noon. Second car we asked got us to Ljubljana. Lucky, but should be quite easy.
Stand closer to the crossroad, so drivers can see you, because the road goes down a bit. Otherwise good spot. I started waiting from 7:30 am, so it was fine amount of time as for me

Good place to go to Bovec.
People use this road to go to Bovec because it's better.
A lot of car’s.
The spot on the way to Italy isn't practical, as there's not really room for the car to stop. But it did the trick for us as a car took us away after 5 minutes.

There is a lot of traffic coming through, and a lot of cars from Germany. Great opportunity to catch a long ride. I had one of my best hitchhiking experiences from here, with someone travelling to Netherlands. The border guards also don't seem to care. With patience you will get a ride. There are also toilets. Peace and love enjoy the ride!
First car that passed by! A dutch guy heading for Munich.
There is a bus stop and place to stop, I have sign Bratislava/ Viena got a catch to maribor
Ok spot if you are heading to Pula
Going to Rijeka, found a lift in less than 10min asking the cars at the gas station.
It was a pretty good spot with one closed line (might be temporary) where we were standing we caught a ride to Maribor
We got lucky because we were sitting in the LIDL parking lot and making a sign with the name Vienna on it, and one man approached us and offered to give us a lift to Austrian border, Sentilj.
Found a french girl who took us to Tarvisio. A lot of traffic.
Not much space for the cars to stop, but a lot of movement anyways.

We decided to try here after trying the parking lot spot with little luck for a while. The idea was to be visible to all vehicles, even those not planning on stopping at the station, since the traffic was low. It worked; a couple saw us, felt bad, and actually entered the petrol station through the exit!! And we got really lucky and got a ride all the way to Innsbruck!

The spot was ok. A little scary to be out near the lanes like this, and some people gave us dirty looks, but all in all prett
There is enough space for vehicles to stop

Got a ride to Ljubljana from here. Just walked the road from the castle back towards the villages, thumbing any cars coming from the castle. Didn't want to wait at a spot since it was't peak season yet and the castle had just closed so not too many cars.
Everybody is going either Italy, Croatia or Ljubljana but it's only highway so probably you will only find Slovens

We (2 people) wanted to hitchhiked from this place but a guy saw us on the LIDL parking lot and gave us a lift to the Austrian border. It really seems like a good place, a lot of cars going in direction of Austria, and there is a small bay for the cars to stop.
Got a ride to the roundabout after 15 minutes.
2 people boy and girl wait with sign for Graz and for 30 min catch up. Good place.
We hitchhiked from here towards Hungary. Most people are going to Graz, so we had to wait so long. There were some other guys wo wanted to go to Austria, they only waited 10 mintues.

We (a couple) wanted to go to Hungary. This motorway goes to Austria too, and it seemed more people went there. And on this spot also many people goes to the center, so it's around 15% of cars goes in the direction of Hungary. But the hope is that there is big traffic. When we were fed up, a very luxus car stopped for us and took us near to the border.

Not many cars, but still enough flow to get someone. For cars I would recommend the previous gas station (Sentilj), it looked like it had so much more flow of people (KFC, restaurant, etc). For trucks this one is better.
tried to hitch to Vienna, took us a while but for germany i think its a really decent spot
Quite busy petrol station near border. We waited for more than an hour. A driver gave us a lift to Vienna.

Pretty busy spot with plenty of cars heading to the north. Most people were going to Czech Republic/Poland, but I managed to get a direct ride to Wurzburg after about an hour of wandering around the service area. Overall, a very decent spot.

The only question is which service station is best out of three to continue towards Vienna, Linz/Salburg or Ljubljana or Zagreb. Service station Gralla in Austria, the Slovenian station 1 km south of the border or the Slovenian station north of Maribor on the A1... that truly is the only question... who wants to test them all ten times in both directions? ;) 

(and then, once we find out, and all five zillion hitch-hikers know about it, which will then automatically make the best service station
the original spot seems to no longer be there. first we waited at the bus stop for 1:30 hours with a few locals stopping. We walked 100m down the road, where we got picked up after 30 minutes
Found this spot randomly. A car took two guys to Podgrad (a few km forward). We waited 30 minutes
Not full road but enough cars and trucks passing by I think, A car took me dircetly to Rijeka
On the entrance of the parking of a restaurant, a lot of place for cars to stop
Plenty car driving slow, one road, easy to get to the coastal towns
Not many card coming from croatia
Probably better to go to the Croatian site of the border. Stood close to the border station, as cars go slow there.
One driver from austria took me to Graz. I waited for less than 5 minutes. It is a bit tricky for a car to stop, but the red light takes ages to change.

Been there a couple of times, hithiking to Graz. Two of us, m+f, standing in the green area in between directions, close to the traffic light, with a sign, during red light approaching people coming from the city and turning left to Graz. Started around 7:30, on working days, it didn't take us more than 20 mins to get a ride. We also tried the other spot, just when you turn left, but we found it much easier with cars that have already stopped at the traffic light.

It's a great spot to get to Italy or Koper, but we were trying to get to Rijeka, and no one was going that way. We decided to walk the 4-5 km to crossroad the 6 and the A1, and hitchhiked there after literally two minutes.
i just had to lift the rating because this gas station is an excellent one for direction italy. one can get a lift to venice just btw, i've got several way further further, once even to milano.

If you want to go to Rijeka you might want to consider taking a lift to the Postonja exit 2 km further, and then hitching on the 6. Most people go only to Postonja or further down the A1 to Koper. We waited a few hours at this gas station, and then decided to get to the exit, which took us a few minutes since we just asked people (literally everyone has to pass this exit). You might have more luck there (we did), though there is no shelter in case of bad weather.

lots of tourists and people from all across Europe driving home to their families in SE Europe, but a lot of them are thightly packed. finally caught an albanian trucker who drove us all the way to Dubrovnik and evenb let us sleep in one of the cars he was carrying. If you go far its worth sticking around here, lots of potential

The only question is which service station is best out of three to continue towards Vienna, Linz/Salburg or Ljubljana or Zagreb. Service station Gralla in Austria, the Slovenian station 1 km south of the border or the Slovenian station north of Maribor on the A1... that truly is the only question... who wants to test them all ten times in both directions? ;) 

(and then, once we find out, and all five zillion hitch-hikers know about it, which will then automatically make the best service station
gas station and resturant. got a ride to ljubljiana after a long time in the night. good also for croatia

2 people, a girl and a boy. 
We tried it with a sign at the end of the gas station, but it was too late and it was a thursday evening, so not a lot of cars. After 1 hour of trying we asked a croatian couple to give us a ride and they did, all the way to Rijeka. Also a tip: if you want to sleep in Rijeka, try the beach. definitely the best spot. The one we slept on is the Glavanovo beach, there is a lot of stairs to get there so no poeple want to go there at night and you have your own personal

BAD for going to ITALY!!!
We wanted to go to Trieste but could only find people going to Ljubljana. To get to Ljubljana from there shouldn't be hard.
No one is using this road to go to LJ, everybody gos to the highway. It's better to walk up to the Grof hotel and try from the bus station there.

As a male hitchhiker, I waited here for approx. 15 minutes with a sign saying "LJ" on a Friday afternoon.
It was a nice trip and the guy who picked me up drove me all the way to LJ, even if he was living in Kamnik.

This good spot is in Vransko's gas-station.
A good spot to hitchhike to Ljubljana, as an alternative to the highway.
This place is impossible now, there is no good place to stop and almost no one uses the old road anymore. It is better to go up to Grof and try from there.

I am a man and I waited here for approx 10 minutes on a Friday, at around 6 PM with a sign saying "MB".
Very good spot, from my experience!

This is a good spot to hitchhike towards Maribor.
It's right before the entrance on the highway. The spot is after you pass Vransko. It's actually a small road that goes to the right, from the main road, to a house.
The spot is very good because the cars can see you from the distance and they have enough room to park and pick you up.
Very dangerous spot. Nowhere to wait.
Easy to get Maribor Centrum. waiting time is 5 min.
We didn't get any cars to Celje or Maribor. If you want to go to Maribor go to the MOL next to Zaloška street.
hey there the bus stop is named nove jarše. will add it so people will know :) with your waiting time of course :)

+1 to Shelob
I was here on Saturday too, it took me about 30 minutes to get a cat to Celje but no to Maribor
I agree with Shelob too. We caught the ride to Maribor in 50min. It was on Saturday so there wasn´t big traffic.
I agree with Shelob

Waited for a while, it's a nice spot for the direction koper or novo mesto, but sadly we didn't get a ride. probably because it was saturday and not much traffic, 2 cars stopt one was going in the wrong direction and the other didn't have enough space for 2 people, so we checked bus prises and gave up, good luck to the next ones who try the spot :)
Good spot to go out of the city. Wanted to go direction Zagreb with a sign Novo mesto - Zagreb. People didn’t drove to fast and place to stop at the bus station
Really bad spot, no space to stop..
Not the best spot for hitchhiking but I was a Sunday morning, not busy so cars could stop easily. We were lucky to found a car in 2min to go on the highway
this spot should be removed since there's no more bus stop there and thus no space to pull over
There is no longer a bus stop at this place, just a two lane road, I don't think it is a good spot
In summer, when there are a lot of tourists, try the gas station on the south on the A1 it's better I think because you're directly on the highway.

There is a safe place for hitchhiking just before the border crossing. Cars slow down up to 50 km/h and there is a place for save stop. However, almost everybody goes to the Triest city and it’s difficult to find sb going further. A little further, at border crossing, there were policemen but gentile and cheering up in my hitchhiking.
It's a good spot when you want go to Triest but nothing else
difficult to go more than Trieste but it's fine if you ask kindly
There's no much cars stopping here on a November's Sunday. It took us 2 hours to get a ride to Zagreb.
Waited about 10 mins going to Zagreb, on a Monday morning, Sept 2012

About here there is a petrol station, not shown properly on the map. Summer 2012 it was just South of road works which conveniently slowed traffic down. Standing between the station entry ramp and the road (not a motorway at this point) you could get a lift South quite easily. Without the road works it should still be a decent place for going South. I got a lift here from Maribor from a friend.
Got a ride to the service station petrol, waited there 2.5 more hours and then got a ride to Novo mesto

Were travelling boy-girl to Zagreb with a sign ZG, waited for around 30 min until an older man stopped. Got a lift right to the city and as it was evening, he drove us even to our host. Croatian drivers are extremely friendly.
Had to give up here. Most of the drivers shook their heads as there wasn't any time or space for them to pull over on the bend.
Theoretically a good spot in the direction of Novo Mestro and Croatia, but most cars didn't seem to be going that way. Had a 75 min wait as a solo hitcher at friday lunchtime

It looks as good spot to try to hitchhike someone, but it is not. Everyone goes on vacation, so they have got full car or goes only to Maribor. We tried it there for like 6 hours with sign "Ljubljana", but nobody stopped. Good thing about it is a Field behind the gas station for a night in a tent. It is better to ask people then Wait. And maybe ask people with the same nationality. :)
The guy gave us a lift only to a next and bigger gas station. But before it was really quiet not many people driving through. And it was around 1pm on a thursday

I tried to get a lift to Ljubljana which was very difficult. Most of ths cars and trucks are going to Croatia or Maribor. If you can find someone who goes to Croatia, go to the next gas station 8kms on the South. There is a mcdonalds there, more cars and higher chance to find someone to Ljubljana.
With sign Maribor success after 1 m of waiting! :)
Petrol station. Not much traffic and mostly local.

If you want to go in the direction Austria/Jesenice - this is very difficult spot, I stayed there for 2 hours, tried out several signs, at the end I got a short ride to the next rest stop. Going south is great though, got several cars to stop for me, but rejected.
Got a ride quickly in the direction to Ljubljana
Good spot if the busstop/small stop after the circle is free but I was unlucky and they had it blocked off for some reason. Still possible to get rides, especially towards Ljubljana.
Weekday, 7am, end of august. Waited with sign Austria/Germany, lot of traffic to LJ, not many foreigners. Got a lift to Jesenice petrolstation from slovene workers.
2min as a couple on a rainy thursday June morning with sign: LJ, BMW took us to gas station south of LJ
Don’t like it, barely any traffic and none going far just the tiny villages. I gave up on pula and had a sign for koper just to get out of there and it still took an hour

I asked people that came to the gas station for a ride to anywhere in the croatian coast and two super sympatic italian ladies took me, they were going to Rovinj for a holiday. Nice and busy spot, but also many people going to Italy.
we asked people for a ride and nobody wanted to take us, after a while some creep took us, it was horrible
Great spot for hitchhiking to anywhere on the Istria peninsula!
No luck late morning, went to try rest stop on the highway.

We (two guys) waited for about an hour for a ride to Zagreb (with sign). Then we switched to the Avtovestno per
trolstation where we got lucky immediatly.
great spot to catch a car to Zagreb (two girls)

Bus stop doesn’t exist anymore, trying to get to Zagreb in the late afternoon. Got a lift after a long time in the sun by the roundavout to the middle of the highway near krsko by a nice old lady who says she will come back in two hours if no one picks me up.
Waited at a bus stop near the highway for about 5 minutes headed for Ljubljana during the time people get off work (3ish).Very easy
Not a bad place for heading towards Brecize or Zagreb. The two of us had to wait a while in the heat but eventually a friendly worker from the big shopping complex took us to Brecize.
Nice spot for rijeka.
A Slovenian guy took us (we were 2 guy) to Rijeka after 40min. But there is almost no croats that drive here
We got to Postojna (ultimately Rijeka) quite quickly, but a much better spot is at the highway entrance.
Place is horrible, cars going fast but we were lucky and moved a bit towards highway
Not much cars, at least on Sunday. The driver who had helped me here from Ljubljana came back to me to drive me to Trieste <3

many tourists coming from Austria, Germany, with no Space, a Ukrainian dad with his children picked both of us up (m/22) we definitely recommend trying in the morning till afternoon, we waited 3hrs from 18:30 - 21:30 the day before and slept in the woods nearby, the next day it took us 25min to get picked up
There's not too many people going to postojna, but plenty to Ljubljana
Was very lucky to go direction Osilnica, not many cars going in that direction. Easy for continuing in the 106
Local took me for a little bit
Decent, summer holiday and weekend so a lot of people leaving from croatia and slovenia to austria, germany. but i wouldnt recommend.

Pretty bad spot because cars going to Maribor dont have a lot of space to stop and have to turn thru another lane to stop or stop in their lane. Still had great luck when a monk took me to maribor. Next time would look for another spot

2 people, a girl and a boy. We couldn't get out of Vransko from either of the spots, because they're outdated and no one uses the old road anymore. This way people go on the highway so you have a better chance here. Sign to LJ.
until the Italian border, both ways go to Italy (one by highway, the other by the old road

Was standing there with a sign "Zagreb" on Monday afternoon, there were a lot of cars, but vast majority of them were with Maribor car plates, and probably almost noone going towards Croatia. I gave up after 1 hour
An option for getting to the boarder with Croatia
A lot of cars. We get caught in 20 min to go to Villach with a panel indicating Villach/Salzburg.
I had to ask around many people were eating

Not perfect spot, a lot of cars, but it was raining day so maybe because of this a waited long, a lot of people go to graz (which I want to avoid and all austria), Poland, and Czech Republic. I want to go to Prague but I catch a ride to Regensburg
Huge petrol station by the highway, however not very busy, we had to wait hours, and ask for a ride, rather hopeless place to go to Austria
16 hours and no ride to Zagreb. Then we took a bus to Maribor (bus stadion is an 8 min walk) and then a FlixBus.
Huge gas station but not much traffic in the afternoon... but still we got a lift to Wienna in half an hour.

Got stuck here a whole sunday plus a good hour on monday morning before I get a ride to Zagreb airport. Little traffic, mostly local, all cars with croatians plates were either packed or not caring at all.
If you come from Maribor, better to stick to the traffic light in Hoče.
A lot of trucks there. I slept there in a tent and in the morning a truck driver took me to Zagreb.
Got stuck for like 7 hours, very uncommon for us... It was Monday, all the cars going only to Ptuj (not very helpful) and the rest were families with fully loaded cars going for holiday...
We had to wait long maybe because it was evening. Then we got lucky and got a lift beyond Belgrade.
Service station Dravska Polje

croatia joined schengen in 2023 so this border is no longer strictly controlled and cars might be more willing to pick you up. but still, if you can, try get dropped at the service station before this one. we might have been here longer but we got a ride quick enough to zagreb from someone going to bosnia.

Not a great service station to be picked up from at all but better than nothing. Next to no one wants to take you through the strict border control into Croatia and in the end me and my mate had to settle for a drug baron who drove us to Zagreb at 240kph. On the plus side we were there in 10 minutes.
